title: Evaluation and Improvement Strategies for the Effectiveness of Online Classes in Health Professions

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Healthcare Knowledge and Online Learning Experience
context.additional_context: Development and application of a non-real-time class effectiveness evaluation tool in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment.

learning_goals: Participants can analyze interactivity, assessment systems, and ethical considerations in online healthcare professional courses using rubrics.
Participants can write diagnostic reports on instructional effectiveness through learning data collection and qualitative evaluation.
Based on diagnostic results, participants can propose improvements for optimizing lessons in smartphone environments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
